snippet: Winning in the distribution of high-end content is about mining an audience, and you can’t blame technology companies for believing they have relevant skill sets.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column notes Yahoo is seeking to produce high-quality television programs, as its site has no cachet and no discernible way forward; points out that winning in the distribution of high-end content is about mining an audience, and one cannot blame technology companies for believing they have relevant skill sets.
lead_paragraph: Winning in the distribution of high-end content is about mining an audience, and you can’t blame technology companies for believing they have relevant skill sets.

headline.main: Yahoo Rolls the Dice on TV
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Rolls the Dice on TV
